page.title: 16ABBERLEY HALL NURSING HOME
page.content: Abberley Hall is a large detached house built about 1900 which is now used as a private nursing home. There are 40 people staying in the house at the moment, 36 patients and 4 staff. All the patients are old people. There are a lot more ladies than gentlemen. The home was opened in 1984. There is a matron, 3 sisters, 10 trainee nurses 5 cooks, 2 laundry ladies and 1 gardener.There is also another similar house called Abberley House also within the area. The patients are woken up at 6.30am and their breakfast is from 8.00am onwards. The busiest time for the nurses is between 8.00am and 10.00am. They work 8 hour shifts. The patients enjoy the food, and there are 3 main meals and 2 snacks. Where possible they choose their own bed times.The grounds are pleasant.
